Submodules¶

statannotations.Annotator module¶

class statannotations.Annotator.Annotator(ax, box_pairs, plot='boxplot', data=None, x=None, y=None, hue=None, order=None, hue_order=None, **plot_params)¶

Bases: object

Optionally computes statistical test between pairs of data series, and add statistical annotation on top of the boxes/bars. The same exact arguments data, x, y, hue, order, width, hue_order (and units) as in the seaborn boxplot/barplot function must be passed to this function.

This function works in one of the two following modes: a) perform_stat_test is True (default): * statistical test as given by argument test is performed. * The test_short_name argument can be used to customize what appears before the pvalues if test is a string. b) perform_stat_test is False: no statistical test is performed, list of custom p-values pvalues are used for each pair of boxes.

statannotations.format_annotations module¶

statannotations.format_annotations.pval_annotation_text(result: Union[List[statannotations.stats.StatResult.StatResult], statannotations.stats.StatResult.StatResult], pvalue_thresholds: List)¶
Parameters

  • result – StatResult instance or list thereof

  • pvalue_thresholds – thresholds to use for formatting

Returns

A Series of rendered annotations if a list of StatResults was provided, a string otherwise.

statannotations.format_annotations.simple_text(result: statannotations.stats.StatResult.StatResult, pvalue_format, pvalue_thresholds, test_short_name=None) → str¶

Generates simple text for test name and pvalue.

Parameters

  • result – StatResult instance

  • pvalue_format – format string for pvalue

  • test_short_name – Short name of test to show (Default value = None)

  • pvalue_thresholds – String to display per pvalue range

  • result – StatResult

Returns

simple annotation
